summary: UK company GeoPura secures £36m investment to scale its green hydrogen business, replacing fossil fuels with zero-emission alternatives.

title: Vestas unveils circularity solution to end landfill for turbine blades - Vestas
summary: Vestas unveils a circularity solution to end landfill for turbine blades by chemically breaking down epoxy resin into re-usable components, allowing for the recycling of old blades and creation of new turbine blades, thus contributing to a circular economy in the wind industry.
green_innovation: TRUE. This is green innovation as it introduces a solution that significantly reduces environmental impact by promoting recycling and circularity in the wind industry.
business_innovation: TRUE. This is a business innovation as Vestas introduces a new solution that differs significantly from previous practices, offering a new form of circularity in blade recycling.
green_product: TRUE. This is a green product innovation as it involves the design and manufacturing of turbine blades that significantly reduce their environmental impact by promoting recycling and circularity.
green_process: TRUE. This is a green process innovation as the chemical process developed by Vestas minimizes environmental impacts by breaking down epoxy resin into re-usable materials, reducing waste and promoting sustainability.

title: LiTime: New Possibilities in the Lithium Battery Industry - Yahoo Finance
summary: LiTime, formerly known as Ampere Time, is a company that specializes in LiFePO4 lithium batteries and renewable energy solutions. They offer a range of products including batteries, solar charge controllers, and are expanding to include solar panels, portable power stations, battery boxes, and inverters. The company aims to provide eco-friendly and reliable energy storage solutions for both outdoor and home use.

title: Breakthrough technology transforms waste plastic bottles into polymers for lithium-ion batteries - EurekAlert
summary: A team of scientists upcycled waste PET plastic into polymer electrolytes for lithium-ion batteries, addressing plastic waste issue and creating sustainable energy solutions.
green_innovation: TRUE. This is green innovation because it involves upcycling waste plastic into a valuable product with positive environmental impacts, contributing to sustainability goals.
business_innovation: TRUE. This is a business innovation as it involves the introduction of a new product or process, polymer electrolytes from upcycled PET plastics, that differs significantly from previous practices in the field.
green_product: TRUE. The upcycled polymer electrolytes from PET plastics qualify as a green product due to their design, manufacturing, and usage significantly reducing environmental impacts throughout their lifecycle, contributing to sustainability and promoting ecological and human health benefits.
green_process: TRUE. The method of upcycling waste PET plastics into polymer electrolytes for safer lithium-ion batteries aligns with the definition of a green process by minimizing environmental impacts, reducing waste, and promoting sustainability in production and usage.
